key_channel_insights.line_content: 73 % of OTA fares price above direct with a steady 6 % mark-up, signalling margin loss and potential customer deterrence.
85 % of itineraries are cheaper on MSE by 9 % on average, representing the largest uncontrolled revenue leakage across channels.
GDS displays a 71 % higher-than-direct frequency (avg +6 %), limiting corporate agency competitiveness despite improved availability.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA prices exceed direct in 73 % of cases, a 2-pt increase WoW, at a consistent 6 % surcharge.
Only 13 % of offers match direct pricing, down 0.9 pt WoW, reflecting volatile alignment.
Far-out departures now see 75 % OTA overpricing (+13 pts WoW), heightening early-purchase risk.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 12 % of website itineraries are absent on OTA, limiting shelf presence.
True OTA discounts continue to fade, shrinking 0.7 pt WoW.
Despite share shifts, the absolute price gap remains a steady +6 %.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 76 % of short-haul fares are higher on OTA (+6 %); availability gaps are modest (10 %).
Long-haul shows 29 % offer gaps and a lower 57 % overpricing rate (+4 %).

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 74 % of fares price higher on OTA (+5 %), with only 8 % availability gaps.
Offer gaps rise to 24 %, and OTA premiums deepen to +7 %.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA higher share eased to 72 % (−4 pts WoW) but still commands a 6 % premium.
Overpricing surged to 75 % (+13 pts WoW), while parity plunged 9 pts.

mse_highlights.line_content: MSE undercuts direct on 85 % of itineraries, averaging a 9 % discount—up 8 pts MoM.
Matched pricing down to 5 %, a 7-pt MoM decline, eroding price discipline.
92 % of Norway-origin fares are cheaper on MSE by 11 % on average.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: 9 % of web itineraries are unavailable on MSE; small week-to-week change.
Channel delivers an average −9 % fare, frequency up 1 pt WoW.
Cases where MSE is higher remain below 0.1 %, offering limited upside.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 86 % of short-haul ODs are lower-priced on MSE (−10 %).
83 % of long-haul itineraries are cheaper, discount widening to −6 %.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Leakage peaks at 92 % with an 11 % discount; parity minimal (3 %).
67 % of fares cheaper (−5 %); threefold higher parity than Norway.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: MSE is cheaper on 86 % at −8 %; leakage widened 3 pts WoW.
85 % undercut rate with a deeper −12 % gap; share slipped 2 pts WoW.

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS fares average a 6 % premium and show little month-over-month movement.
Website-only gaps fell to 14.6 %, lowest in three months, yet remain high on long-haul (38 %).
Close-in parity improving (+4 pts), far-out overpricing worsening (+9 pts).

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Gaps improved 0.5 pt WoW, aiding agency access.
Alignment slipped 0.7 pt WoW but remains 3 pts higher than last month.
Premium stable at +6 %, suggesting entrenched mark-up strategy.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 74 % higher-price frequency (+6 %), availability gap down to 11 %.
38 % of fares missing; only 49 % overpriced, with a smaller +4 % premium.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 74 % overpricing (+5 %); availability gap limited to 9 %, parity at 17 %.
65 % higher fares but 31 % missing offers; parity only 2 %.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS higher share down to 70 % (−4 pts); parity up to 12.5 %.
Overpricing climbed to 74 % (+9 pts); parity dipped to 14.6 %.
